snippet: Edward J. Snowden insisted that he had been trying to hold Russia’s government to account over its surveillance practices, as he did with the Obama administration.
abstract: Former National Security Agency contractor Edward J Snowden finds himself on defensive day after he took part in televised and carefully orchestrated question-and-answer session with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin; critics accuse him of turning into stooge of Kremlin, but Snowden insists that he was trying to hold Russia's government accountable for its surveillance practices.
lead_paragraph: Edward J. Snowden insisted that he had been trying to hold Russia’s government to account over its surveillance practices, as he did with the Obama administration.

headline.main: Snowden Defends Query to Putin on Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Snowden Defends Query to Putin on Surveillance

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
